title: 104_hr3117
content: AUTHORITY TO ESTABLISH AND OPERATE MANAGED HEALTH-CARE PLANS. The Secretary may establish and operate managed health-care plans under Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code. These plans can be operated through Department health-care facilities and may involve partnerships with other public or private entities for the provision of health services. The Secretary can establish managed health-care plans under Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code, which may involve partnerships with public or private entities for health service provision. The plans must adhere to standards set by the Secretary in consultation with the Secretary of Health and Human Services, including minimum health care benefits for enrolled veterans. The Secretary can establish managed health-care plans for veterans under Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code. The plans must provide minimum health care benefits, including those covered under Medicare. The Secretary may establish an enrollment system for veterans not covered under specific sections. The Secretary has the authority to establish an enrollment system for veterans in managed health-care plans under Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code. Cost-sharing requirements may be set for veterans enrolled in these plans to cover benefits not paid by Medicare. The Secretary can establish an enrollment system for veterans in managed health-care plans under Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code. Cost-sharing requirements, such as enrollment premiums, copayments, and deductibles, may apply for benefits not covered by Medicare. Payments received for care provided to veterans enrolled in these plans will be credited to the Department's medical appropriation. The Secretary cannot operate a plan at a Department facility without the director's approval. The Secretary must ensure that sufficient medical care funds are allotted to a Department facility before operating a plan under subsection (a) to provide hospital care and medical services to veterans. The director must allocate funds for hospital care and medical services for veterans likely to require them during the fiscal year. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections in the chapter. Establishment of managed health-care plans and requirement for payment for certain services provided by Department facilities. The new section 1729A of Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code, allows the Secretary of Health and Human Services to make Medicare payments for certain veterans enrolled in Department managed health care plans. The new section 1729A of Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code allows the Secretary of Health and Human Services to make Medicare payments for veterans enrolled in Department managed health care plans under similar terms as payments to other eligible managed care health plans. The new section 1729A of Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code allows the Secretary of Health and Human Services to make Medicare payments for veterans enrolled in Department managed health care plans under similar terms as payments to other eligible managed care health plans. Veterans meeting certain criteria will be certified as Medicare Choice organizations under the Social Security Act. The Secretary will annually certify Department managed health care plans that meet prescribed standards. The term 'Medicare program' refers to the health insurance program under title XVIII of the Social Security Act. The new section 1729A of Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code allows Medicare payments for veterans enrolled in Department managed health care plans. The terms 'Medicare program', 'Medicare-eligible veteran', and 'Medicare Choice organization' are defined under this section. Section 1729A of title 38, United States Code allows Medicare payments for veterans in Department managed health care plans, effective after the enactment of this Act.
